abstract: Aaron Hand, mortgage broker in prison for fraud scheme, pleads not guilty to murder and conspiracy charges in State Supreme Court in Manhattan; Hand sought hit man to kill 1 of his 26 co-defendants in mortgage fraud case in which he had been convicted in 2010 and sentenced to up to 25 years in prison.
snippet: The $150 Aaron Hand wanted from his parents was not for a prison guard, but for a man he believed was a killer for hire.
lead_paragraph: The $150 Aaron Hand wanted from his parents was not for a prison guard, but for a man he believed was a killer for hire.

headline.main: Prisoner in Mortgage Fraud Sought Hit Man, Charges Say
headline.print_headline: Prisoner in Mortgage Fraud Sought Hit Man, Charges Say
headline.seo: Prisoner Aaron Hand Is Charged With Trying to Get a Witness Killed
